intro: Plectranthastrum cylindricalyx, commonly known as the cylindrical leaf plectranthus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lamiaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and narrow, cylindrical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, tubular flowers that are typically purple or blue in color, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. This plant is often cultivated as an ornamental due to its unique foliage and ability to attract pollinators.
